title: How to Draw a Strawberry Sundae

steps.headline: Draw the shape of an inverted bell.
steps.description: However, leave the top part open by not drawing it in.

steps.headline: Draw the base just as shown in the accompanying illustration.
Now draw a silhouette of a strawberry.
steps.description: Under it, draw the whipped cream, then the ice cream below it.

steps.headline: Draw zigzag lines to separate the strawberry, whipped cream and vanilla ice cream from each other.
Draw lines and shapes for the strawberry sauce.
steps.description: Any irregular shape and squiggly lines will do.

steps.headline: On the base, draw two lines.
steps.description: One short line below the bottom of the glass and one longer line near the bottom.

steps.headline: Color the strawberry with green and red.
steps.description: You can color the strawberry sauce with red too. The glass should appear darker at the bottom and lighter on top. The base should appear darker at the top and lighter at the bottom.

steps.headline: Add small dots to the strawberry.
steps.description: Create a row of small ovals tilted to about 30 degrees. The next row of ovals should not be aligned with the ovals on top but should be aligned with the spaces.

steps.headline: Draw some lines to define the whipped cream.
steps.description: Shade the strawberry sauce and the glass with a lighter shade of red. The glass at the bottom, shade with a darker shade of red. Enjoy your treat!

text: Draw the shape of an inverted bell. However, leave the top part open by not drawing it in. Draw the base just as shown in the accompanying illustration.  Now draw a silhouette of a strawberry. Under it, draw the whipped cream, then the ice cream below it. Draw zigzag lines to separate the strawberry, whipped cream and vanilla ice cream from each other.  Draw lines and shapes for the strawberry sauce. Any irregular shape and squiggly lines will do. On the base, draw two lines. One short line below the bottom of the glass and one longer line near the bottom. Color the strawberry with green and red. You can color the strawberry sauce with red too. The glass should appear darker at the bottom and lighter on top. The base should appear darker at the top and lighter at the bottom. Add small dots to the strawberry. Create a row of small ovals tilted to about 30 degrees. The next row of ovals should not be aligned with the ovals on top but should be aligned with the spaces. Draw some lines to define the whipped cream. Shade the strawberry sauce and the glass with a lighter shade of red. The glass at the bottom, shade with a darker shade of red. Enjoy your treat!
